modules.description: Provides functions to parse command-line options from a list of strings, supporting both short and long flags with associated values. Works with lists of strings and returns a structured representation of parsed options. Used to extract configuration parameters from user input in command-line tools.

This module enables parsing and configuration building for command-line arguments, handling diverse data types like integers, floats, strings, and booleans through specialized handlers for short and long options. It operates on custom type structures such as 'a t and 'b t, along with reference-based state management via functions like store and queue to track option values. Use cases include dynamically constructing option parsers for applications requiring flexible input handling, such as command-line tools with nested configurations or value validation.
